headline: Biden FEC pick claimed Georgia voting machines 'switched' votes from Abrams to Kemp in 2018
sentences:
LATINOS BREAK WITH DEMOCRATS AS REPUBLICANS LOOK FOR MIDTERM MAJORITY WIN
"One troubling problem  encountered by several voters  is that voting machines switched their votes from Leader Stacey Abrams to Secretary Kemp," the 66-page complaint filed Nov. 27, 2018, in U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Georgia alleges.

Lindenbaum's name appears as the third signature on the original complaint in the lawsuit alleging voter suppression in the race that saw then-Republican Secretary of State Brian Kemp defeat Abrams by 55,000 votes statewide in the governor's race.

MSNBC SEGMENT GOES OFF THE RAILS DURING DEBATE OVER VOTER SUPPRESSION
The plaintiffs narrowed the case in an amended complaint filed Dec. 3, 2020, to focus on allegations of poor training of poll workers and the data on voter registration lists.

"These matters, the election security matters, are outside the purview of the Federal Election Commission, which is solely focused on campaign finance issues and not the issues of election administration machines," Lindenbaum responded.

At her current job, Lindenbaum counsels clients on complying with state and federal campaign finance and election laws and represents clients in federal and state courts, as well as before the FEC and state and local election boards.

ARIZONA WILL REQUIRE VOTERS TO PROVE CITIZENSHIP AND RESIDENCY, ANGERING ACTIVISTS
"Do you think criticizing an election as stolen or otherwise invalid undermines the public faith in the democratic process?"

The Senate Rules and Administration Committee held a confirmation hearing for Lindenbaum, a lawyer with the Washington firm of Sandler, Reiff, Lamb, Rosenstein & Birkenstock, to be a commissioner on the FEC.
President Biden's recent nominee to serve on the Federal Election Commission represented a Stacey Abrams-backed nonprofit in a lawsuit that made several unproven allegations of voter suppression.
Cruz noted the lawsuit Lindenbaum represented sought to permanently enjoin the secretary of state and the Georgia state Board of Elections and declare Georgia's election process unconstitutional.
"As an officer of the court, you were willing to put your name on a legal pleading alleging that the machines used in Georgia in 2018 were switching votes illegally from one candidate to another.
Previously, Lindenbaum was an associate counsel in the Voting Rights Project at the Lawyers' Committee for Civil Rights Under Law, a left-leaning legal nonprofit.
The lawsuit named two voters who said they had to vote for Abrams on the voting machine four times because the first three times it identified Kemp.
Biden nominated Lindenbaum to the FEC in January, weeks after he delivered remarks on the one-year anniversary of the Jan. 6, 2021 Capitol riot.
Nominee Dara Lindenbaum also signed on to court papers alleging voting machines "switched" votes during the 2018 Georgia gubernatorial race.
Days later, the Georgia trial for Fair Fight Action and Care in Action v. Raffensperger began in U.S. District Court in Atlanta.
The complaint says another voter is said to have "kept pressing Abrams and, by the fourth time, the machine finally corrected."
She went on to tell Cruz "that case is in very active litigation" and "I am very much limited in what I can say about it."
She said that Kemp won the 2018 governor's race and that Abrams acknowledged Kemp's victory nine days after the election.
In that speech, Biden excoriated predecessor Donald Trump for casting doubt on the integrity of the electoral process.
"The U.S. Senate must reject this nominee," Georgia Attorney General Chris Carr, a Republican, said of Lindenbaum.
"When some Trump supporters claimed machines switched votes from Trump to Biden in 2020, Democrats went bananas.
"The complaint you filed argued that the machines in 2018 actually switched votes for Abrams to votes for Kemp.
In one case, it said, only after a voter's "fourth attempt was she able to cast a ballot for Leader Abrams."
"She has spent the last four years making fake claims of voter suppression and pushing conspiracy theories.
"The FEC is supposed to be a neutral body that instills confidence in our elections," Carr told Fox News.
"This [Lindenbaum] appointment shows the hypocrisy of the left," said Carr, the Georgia attorney general.
Abrams launched Fair Fight Action, a nonprofit advocacy group, after losing the 2018 governor's race.
Lindenbaum did note that she was representing Fair Fight Action and not Abrams as an individual.
Sen. Ted Cruz, R-Texas, asked about the matter during the confirmation hearing April 6.

"Those allegations were all based on affidavits and other stories from voters."
"The complaint, I believe, had those allegations in it," Lindenbaum responded.
Carr wrote a letter to Senate leaders urging them to reject the nomination.
The amended complaint omitted the prior allegations about voting machines.
"It can, I think it depends on the context involved," Lindenbaum replied.
Kemp is in a Republican primary against former GOP senator David Purdue.
